title: Bitstream Font Classification System
content:
Can anybody please explain, the bitstream  
classification system.

They put these numbers in front of their  
fonts(or categories), like 921, 924, 911, 721 etc.

What is the significance of these numbers ?
author: richard_a

comments.content:
LOL - I have never known myself. Just about every font that was given such a number is a rip-off of a well-known font.  
I don't know if you are familiar with: [http://desktoppub.about.com/cs/findafont/a/fontaliases\_f.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20111216181425/http:/desktoppub.about.com/cs/findafont/a/fontaliases_f.htm "http://desktoppub.about.com/cs/findafont/a/fontaliases\_f.htm") -- it is a handy reference and lets you know all the "real" names for Bitstream fonts. I've started you off in the "F" section....
